cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 625 mi SW of the southern tip of Baja California
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn north then north-northeast, moving toward the northern Baja California peninsula and the lower Colorado River Valley/south-west Arizona early next week

weather_observation.impacted_coast: south-west Mexico, Baja California peninsula, portions of southern California and south-west Arizona coastline
weather_observation.wind: Low (11%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; most likely winds below gale force
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected; system remains east of the California coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain to coastal southern California, but totals near port unlikely to reach 4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large long-period swells creating hazardous surf and rip currents along the southern California coast beginning this weekend
